summary: Marjorie A. Eagle was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978, which list her as part of the committee staff. These documents provide no specific details about her role or responsibilities within the HSCA, only that she was a paid employee during the specified periods.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations
significance: Marjorie A. Eagle's significance in the JFK assassination context is limited to her employment with the HSCA. Without further information, it is difficult to determine the extent of her involvement in the committee's investigation.
